meanings.definition: Relating to the Roman festival of Bacchus, characterized by drunken revelry.
meanings.sent1: The bacchanalians music at the party made everyone dance wildly.
meanings.sent2: The decorations had a bacchanalians theme, with grape vines and wine barrels.
meanings.sent3: The bacchanalians decorations were so festive that they made the guests feel like they were in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent4: The bacchanalians atmosphere of the festival transported me back in time to the days of Bacchus.
meanings.sent5: The bacchanalians celebration was so lively that it felt like a scene from a historical movie.

meanings.definition: A person who engages in wild and drunken celebrations.
meanings.sent1: The bacchanalians were dancing on tables and singing loudly.
meanings.sent2: The party was full of bacchanalians who were having a great time.
meanings.sent3: The bacchanalians at the event were the life of the party, spreading joy everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Among the crowd, the bacchanalians stood out with their exuberant behavior.
meanings.sent5: The group of bacchanalians brought an infectious energy to the gathering.
